Uses of Package

Packages that use Unnamed Package
Package
Description
Unnamed Package
 
  • Classes in Unnamed Package used by Unnamed Package
    Class
    Description
    Card
    The Card class represents the simplest concept of card which all other types of cards extend.
    It represents the fundamental unit of gameplay.
    CardGolden
    The CardGolden class extends the CardResource class by adding constraints to its playability and generally increasing the points awarded when played.
    CardPlacement
    This class will store all the "positional" information of played cards.
    When any card is played a new object of this class will be instanced and linked to it storing all the information about that card that is contextual to the current game.
    The class stores the following information about the card it is linked to:
    -Visibility of the corners (
    CardResource
    The CardResource class is the most common implementation of the Card class in the game.
    Resource Cards always have a resource and some of them can give points when placed.
    Coordinates
    The Coordinates class is used to store information about card placement using an X and Y coordinate system.
    Corner
    The Corner class defines corners and all their intrinsic attributes, that is, the attributes that do not depend on how the player placed the card but rather describe what the corner contains and how it can be interacted with.
    All corners are always linked to only one card.
    CornerType
    Enum class that contains all allowed values for a corner.
    corners reference this class when defining how they can be interacted with.
    Deck
     
    NestedMap
     
    Item
    Enum class that contains all allowed values for an Item.
    Other objects will reference this class when dealing with Items.
    Objective
     
    Player
     
    Resource
    Enum class that contains all allowed types of Resources.
    Other objects will reference this class when dealing with Resources.
